Recap: Edmund continues to help Cassie move to the farm where she and Tammy have many memories. Cassie continues to try to get Edmund back, and Edmund helps Tammy with a new way to get Joey at the farm. Sandy turns to Buzz for relationship advice, little does Buzz know, but the person that Sandy is so interested in is Buzz's granddaughter. Lizzie continues to pursue Joey. Michelle is released from the hospital, and returns to the house that she don't remember. She finds a teddy bear and want to know about her and Danny and whether or not they have children.

bill: You think she's ready to go home?

Edmund: Well, it's not that i don't want it, tammy.

Tammy: Well, what is it? Mom is not going to be happy until the two of you are together. And having us live out here and you living in town isn't going to make it any easier for you two to hook back up.

cassie: Tammy's right. The farm has history, good and bad.

You gave me a home for me and my kids. Don't you see that's why i'm here? And I know that we can be happy and we can be together here.

Cassie: We have our own history. And it started that afternoon in the hayloft when you told me you love me. Edmund, I thought we'd be together forever.

Lizzie: I'm sorry. So does this mean we can still do the project together?
Joey: Yes, yes, we can still do the project together. Work is work. We could do it right now.
Lizzie: Okay. So go put on some music, any kind you want. Just pick it.
Joey: Music to work by coming right up. Wait a second. I've got it.

Joey: The project. The project that we could pitch to your grandfather. It's a winner. It's a total winner.
Tony: You know, i've got to tell you, bill, I like the hotel idea, I do. But I see a whole city... Whole city development thing happening.
Bill: Yeah, well, i like the way you think.
Tony: Well, you know, i've got the power, the influence to make it happen. Why not go for it? You're interested?
